intro: Psorospermum axillare, commonly known as the axillary psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
